title: Cloud-Services Firm Fastly Hires Google Executive as CFO
summary: The San Francisco-based company went public in 2019 but has not yet turned a profit. Fastly Inc. hired a Google executive to manage its finances as the cloud-services provider looks to boost its revenue.

title: The New Racial Discrimination
summary: The Biden Administration's 'equity' policies are losing in court.. The Supreme Court recently put off whether to hear a case accusing Harvard of discriminating by race in admissions. The Court asked the Biden Administration for its view of the case, punting a decision to next fall or later. We hope the Justices realize that sooner or later they will have to decide whether the new wave of racial discrimination is constitutional.

title: Debating Vaccine Mandates on Campus
summary: Students weigh the pros and cons of their colleges' vaccine rules.. Editor's note: This Future View discusses college vaccine mandates. Next, we'll ask about the coming financial compensation of college athletes: "Is the old idea of the 'student athlete' finished?" Students should click here to submit opinions of fewer than 250 words before July 13. The best responses will be published that night.

title: The Taliban's March to Kabul
summary: Security in Afghanistan is deteriorating faster than the U.S. admits.. Americans of a certain age recall the humiliating U.S. flight from Saigon as the North Vietnamese army marched into the city in 1975: The desperate pleas of Vietnamese at the U.S. Embassy gates, the last helicopters taking off from the Embassy roof. Could we soon see the same in Afghanistan?

title: This Surprising Supreme Court
summary: A ruling on a pipeline shows the diversity of constitutional views.. When is a case about a pipeline about more than the pipeline? When it produces a 5-4 Supreme Court decision with a surprising mix of conservative and liberal Justices on both sides. Their opinions reflect disagreements from the founding era over the role and power of the federal government.

title: Pelosi's Jan. 6 Commission
summary: Half the country won't believe its findings no matter who's on it.. Nancy Pelosi is giving her plan to investigate the Jan. 6 Capitol riot one more try, and this one looks even less likely to find a common set of credible facts and conclusions.

title: I Translated Articles for Apple Daily. Can I Go Home to Hong Kong?
summary: The paper is shuttered, and several colleagues are in jail under Beijing's National Security Law.. I don't know if I'll ever visit home again. If I do, I might be arrested.

title: An Advocacy Group Spins Diversity as Evidence of 'Segregation'
summary: The press eats up a misleading study issued by the Othering and Belonging Institute.. More than 80% of U.S. cities are more segregated racially today than they were 30 years ago, a June 21 study claimed to wide press coverage. The study says it shows the "failures of integration" and that it "flies in the face of the prevailing perceptions that the US has become less segregated since the Civil Rights era."

title: Poetry and the Art of Memory
summary: After I had trouble remembering words, I decided to start memorizing verses.. About 18 months ago, at age 79, I gave myself a new task: memorize 30 poems in five languages. I'm about halfway there-I've learned 15 poems in four languages. Did I give myself this task because I worry about my cognitive decline? Was I trying to "pave new neural roads," as Lisa Genova writes in "Remember: The Science of Memory and the Art of Forgetting"?

title: 'Ding Dong! Avon Calling!' Review: Opening Doors for Women
summary: To ﬁnd and train local sales agents, Avon established a national network of recruiters, creating a unique, female managerial class.. In the 1880s, David H. McConnell was working as a door-to-door book salesman when he had a novel idea. He noticed that the housewives he cold-called, while seldom interested in buying his encyclopedias, were thrilled with the complimentary perfume samples he offered. What if he were to jettison books for cosmetics, recruit a nationwide sales corps of housewives, and then capitalize on their local social circles to move his merchandise?

title: A New Chance at 2016 Mysteries
summary: Inspector Horowitz revisits the still-secret Russian intercept behind it all.. At the instigation of the Biden Justice Department, its inspector general Michael Horowitz is launching yet another investigation related to the 2016 election. He will pursue a question that might have Democrats in Congress and the media cheering more loudly if they hadn't already encountered Mr. Horowitz's willingness to unearth truths that are not useful to Democrats and the media.

title: The U.S. Government and Political Surveillance
summary: The media pack that ignored the crime of Kevin Clinesmith is fascinated by a claim from Tucker Carlson.. In theory, a free press serves as a valuable watchdog against government officials who wield enormous power and are prone to abuse it. In practice, the media establishment prefers acting as a watchdog on behalf of people in government. How else to explain this week's disparate treatment of two stories about federal surveillance? Media folk are more angry at a television host who claims that the government spies on him than they are at a former FBI official who admitted that he fabricated evidence that allowed the government to spy on a U.S. citizen.

title: New Jersey Attorney General Chosen as SEC Enforcement Director
summary: The appointment of Gurbir Grewal comes after U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission Chairman Gary Gensler's prior pick resigned a few days into her tenure. The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Tuesday said it would tap New Jersey Attorney General Gurbir Grewal to lead its efforts to police Wall Street, signaling a change of direction after a previous pick was criticized by progressives.

title: Biden, in Wisconsin, Touts Job-Creating Potential of Infrastructure Deal
summary: Progressives want plan paired with antipoverty package but signal they won't police Biden's sales pitch. President Biden hailed his infrastructure deal as a job-creating economic boon, while progressive Democrats signaled they would give the president wiggle room on selling the plan, which they want paired with a wide-ranging antipoverty proposal.

title: Where to Search for Jobs: Finding Your Next Opportunity
summary: Most Popular News. Finding the perfect job takes time, patience and the right resources. As of May 2021, data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics showed that unemployed people are out of work for 19.3 weeks, or about 5 months, according to Indeed.com. The time it takes for you to find a job may vary depending on your industry, location and level of experience. It might seem counterintuitive, but the more experienced you are, the longer it may take you to find a job, because employers may see you as overqualified. But there are some ways you can make the search more constructive.

title: New York Opioid Trial Opens With Emails Joking About Epidemic
summary: Case marks first time a jury will hear allegations that drugmakers and distributors flooded U.S. with painkillers and fueled a health crisis. As an opioid epidemic raged across the U.S. a decade ago, employees at a major distributor of prescription drugs sent emails joking about addicts, jurors were told Tuesday during opening statements at a Long Island trial seeking to blame the pharmaceutical industry for a wave of opioid addiction.

title: Stocks' Modest Gains Give Nasdaq, S&P 500 Records
summary: Dow also rises after consumer confidence exceeds expectations. U.S. stocks edged higher Tuesday, pushing the S&P 500 and the Nasdaq Composite to new records, after a choppy trading session that saw many major sectors swing between losses and gains.

title: Schools Weigh Discipline After Supreme Court Ruling on Student Speech
summary: Court says most off-campus speech online is protected, but the bar for punishable social-media behavior remains blurry. Mondays are usually when Bill Ziegler hears about the latest drama unfolding at the suburban Philadelphia high school where he is a principal. That is when social-media posts uploaded by students over the weekend spill into chatter on campus and have the potential to snowball into a disruptive force.

title: Old Broadway, New Voices
summary: Seven plays by Black authors are hitting the New York stage this fall but not Katori Hall's 'The Hot Wing King,' which won this year's Pulitzer Prize. But it's not too late to change that..

title: 'Martha Gets Down and Dirty' Review: Stewart Steals the Show
summary: The lifestyle guru's new Discovery+ series is filled with gardening tips, backyard grill recipes, and celebrity guest appearances from the likes of Kim Kardashian and Seth Meyers.. Once described as "America's goddess of domestic perfection," Martha Stewart has had at least nine media lives, the latest of which will be playing out on "Martha Gets Down and Dirty." Hosting from her 150-acre farm in Bedford, N.Y., she shares tips on outdoor decorating, grilling, gardening, chainsaw sharpening and peacock raising. It's a distillation, in a way, of all things Stewart, who at age 79 clearly doesn't give a rap about what she says, or to whom: Instructing her first Zoom guest, Kim Kardashian, on planting tomato seeds, Ms. Stewart warns about the hazards of buying just the right potting soil when going to the store. "Do you go to the store, Kim?" she asks Ms. Kardashian. You could cut the tension with a cake spatula.

title: 'America: The Motion Picture' Review: Hysterical Fiction
summary: In this animated Netflix mashing of American idols, Channing Tatum, Judy Greer, Killer Mike and others give voice to a George Bon Jovi Washington and other figures you'll never meet in a history book. Declaring its independence from sanity, the animated "America: The Motion Picture" opens at Ford's Theater, where best buds Abraham Lincoln and George Washington have come to see Red, White & Blue Man Group (also on the bill: "Our American Cousin Vinny"). Benedict Arnold, who's already wiped out the Continental Congress with automatic weapons, turns into a werewolf and kills Lincoln. George, whose weapons of choice are the chainsaws strapped to his arms, wants to fulfill Abe's dying wish and establish a country, but to do so he has to ally himself with the drunken frat boy-brewer Sam Adams, Paul Revere (who is half horse) and Tom Edison, a gender-ambiguous Asian hipster who channels electricity into a way of short-circuiting the redcoats. All of whom are working for the evil King James. Geronimo shows up, too.

title: Intel Delays New Chip in First Setback for CEO's Turnaround Effort
summary: Server-chip delay comes as rival AMD has taken market share. Chip maker Intel Corp. is delaying production of one of its newest chips to improve performance, the first significant product setback under new Chief Executive Pat Gelsinger as he seeks to rebuild the company's competitiveness.

title: Alzheimer's Drug Puts the Spotlight on the FDA
summary: It was never a good idea to make proof of efficacy part of the drug-approval process.. The debate over the Food and Drug Administration's approval of the new Alzheimer's drug Aduhelm ("The Attack on an Alzheimer's Drug," Review & Outlook, June 22) misses the larger point: It was never a good idea to make proof of efficacy part of the FDA drug-approval process.

title: Bitcoin Experiment in El Salvador Does Not Threaten Freedom
summary: Salvadorans can pay their taxes and debts in one of two currencies, neither of which is controlled by their government.. Steve Hanke and Manuel Hinds's op-ed "El Salvador's Big Bitcoin Mistake" (June 23) histrionically compares the country's Bitcoin Law to "forced tender" currency laws in the Soviet Union and Nazi Germany. But the Bitcoin Law does not prohibit merchants from accepting payments in dollars, euros, Honduran lempiras or any other currency. The U.S. dollar also remains legal tender under the law, giving Salvadorans the rare opportunity to pay their taxes and debts in one of two currencies, neither of which is controlled by the Salvadoran government-hardly the stuff of totalitarian regimes.

title: U.S. Hog Prices Sink as China Rebuilds Herd
summary: Prices for U.S. hogs have slipped since the Chinese government said its supplies have nearly fully recovered from African swine fever. Prices for hogs in the U.S. are tumbling in the wake of China's announcement that the country's herds have recovered from the African swine fever.

title: The Value of the Dividend, Present and Posthumous
summary: Oliver Wendell Holmes Sr. knew to keep his memory green.. In "Are Smaller Dividends From Corporations Really So Bad?" (Letters, June 25), Jim Wandrey argues we would be better off if firms reduced their dividends, as they "might invest the money in their own operations-presumably creating more jobs and new products." But dividends are a covenant between a corporation and its owners. Stock investing involves risk, and dividends help to offset that risk. The return from a dividend is always accretive, and the yield puts a floor on the stock price.

title: The Ways We Think and Talk About Our Weight
summary: One reason children develop eating disorders is negative body talk from their parents.. Seeing an article about eating disorders juxtaposed with another that encourages extreme focus on weight is upsetting ("Eating Disorders Surge in Kids" and "Steps for Resuming a Healthy Lifestyle," Personal Journal, June 22).

title: What Does the U.S. Owe Its Interpreters in Afghanistan?
summary: If Biden can allow illegal aliens to come across the border for asylum, certainly he can grant asylum to those who helped U.S. soldiers.. Matt Watters's op-ed "The Debt the U.S. Owes to My Afghan Interpreter-and Others" (June 26) makes my blood boil. To President Biden and his administration, I say: Cut the red tape. If you can allow illegal aliens to come across the border for asylum, certainly you can grant asylum to these brave interpreters and others who helped our soldiers and, in many cases, saved their lives. Bring them and their families here now. Donald Trump would do it.

title: Flicker (Wednesday Crossword, June 30)
Serena Williams Exits Wimbledon With Injury
summary: The 23-time major title winner appeared to turn her ankle in the first set of her first-round match. LONDON-Serena Williams waited two years, through injury and a global pandemic, to return to Wimbledon's Centre Court on Tuesday. Her stay lasted all of 34 minutes, cut short by a slip that forced her to withdraw from the tournament.

title: Supreme Court Rules New Jersey Can't Block Natural-Gas Pipeline
summary: Court says pipeline developer can invoke federal eminent domain power to acquire state property. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court on Tuesday removed a hurdle to the construction of a natural-gas pipeline through Pennsylvania and New Jersey, ruling the pipeline developer could invoke the power of the federal government to take state property needed for the project.

title: Browser Redesigns Aim to Give Users Sleeker Experience
summary: The updates on Safari and Firefox introduce a new way to organize and see tabs. Mozilla Corp. and Apple Inc. are updating their internet browsers to streamline the user experience, including for the workaday tabs that organize multiple open webpages, in a reminder that tech companies' high-profile battle over online privacy isn't the only front in their fight for users.

title: Bringing Weirdos to Life, From a 'Veep' Sycophant to an Evil Disney Twin
summary: Resume Subscription. The funny thing about playing comedic characters? "They never grow. They're literally in a state of arrested development," says Tony Hale, who has played some beloved ones-including on the series "Arrested Development."

title: Fires at Catholic Churches on Indigenous Land in Canada Deemed Suspicious
summary: The fires, which occurred after graves were found near two former church-run schools, have been deemed suspicious. Police in western Canada are investigating fires that destroyed four Roman Catholic churches in just over a week as suspicious, and are examining a possible link to the discovery of unmarked graves near two former residential schools for indigenous children.

title: Miami-Area Condo Failure: Years of Warnings, but Mixed Signals
summary: Resume Subscription. When warning signs flashed about structural and maintenance problems at Champlain Towers South, the information was muted and confusing, signaling that the condo owners didn't need to remedy the situation urgently, according to a preliminary review by The Wall Street Journal of historical documents, eyewitness accounts and expert assessments.

title: Southwest Offers Workers Double Pay to Avoid July Travel Snags
summary: Carrier blames bad weather for cancellations, as pilots say the higher wages won't solve a staffing shortage. Southwest Airlines Co. is increasing overtime pay, including offering double-time pay for flight attendants, in an effort to head off potential staffing crunches during the Fourth of July travel weekend.

title: House Votes to Repeal Two Older Military Force Authorizations
summary: AUMFs relate to the 1991 Gulf War and a 1957 measure countering 'Communist aggression'. WASHINGTON-The House voted 366-46 to repeal two decades-old authorizations of the use of military force in the Middle East, or AUMFs, as Congress moves to reassert its constitutional powers to declare war.

title: Camp Lighter-How New, Compact Gear Makes It Easy to Get Outdoors
summary: Resume Subscription. BEFORE Kata Polano set out on her first combination backpacking and long-distance trail-running trip last year, her biggest concern was hauling the supplies she would need on the 37-mile overnight journey. While many backpackers have long seen 30 pounds as the ultimate lightness goal for their bags, Ms. Polano explained that "fastpacking" demands a level of agility that any extra weight can dash. Thanks in part to the increasing availability of new ultra-lightweight camping and hiking gear, the tattoo artist from Revelstoke, British Columbia, was able to condense her load to under half that amount. "Why would you carry 30 pounds on your back when you can carry 12?" Ms. Polano said.

title: Supreme Court Rules Noncitizens Who Re-Enter U.S. Illegally Must Be Held
summary: Majority rules that repeat violators can't seek bail during asylum proceedings. WASHINGTON-The Supreme Court ruled Tuesday that deported noncitizens who re-enter the U.S. illegally and claim asylum must remain in custody while their cases are processed.

title: Ethiopia Conflict Takes Turn as Tigray Rebels Retake Regional Capital
summary: Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed's war plans in tatters as Ethiopian forces and administrators forced to withdraw. Eight months after claiming victory over the rebellious region of Tigray, Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmedhas been beaten into a shock retreat, his forces ejected from the regional capital after a lightning rebel offensive that could change the shape of geopolitics across the strategically vital Horn of Africa.

title: SEC Charges JPMorgan Unit Neovest for Operating as Unregistered Broker-Dealer
summary: The electronic-trading platform agrees to pay $2.75 million fine for failing to register as broker-dealer. The Securities and Exchange Commission said it has charged Neovest Inc., a JPMorgan Chase & Co. unit that provides an electronic-trading platform, for operating as an unregistered broker-dealer.

title: Savvy Wine Shopping: Tips From a Trusted Retailer
summary: In the final lesson of a crash course in wine appreciation, our columnist takes her young pupil shopping-and he'll never look at a wine store the same way again. The last in a three-part series on the fundamentals of wine appreciation.

title: Masks? Tests? Summer Camp Rules This Year Are Tricky
summary: Resume Subscription. After the CDC relaxed its guidelines on mask-wearing last month, Allison Foster worried about what that would mean for her kids' summer camp. Neither is old enough to be vaccinated against Covid. She wanted to make sure that their camps would still require masks for counselors, even if they'd had their shots.

title: U.S. Home-Price Growth Rose to Record in April
summary: S&P CoreLogic Case-Shiller national index of average home prices up 14.6%. U.S. home prices surged at their fastest pace ever in April as buyers competing for a limited number of homes on the market pushed the booming housing market to new records.

title: Family of MLB Pitcher Tyler Skaggs Sues Angels, Ex-Employees for Wrongful Death
summary: The pitcher died of a fentanyl overdose in a Texas hotel room in 2019. Skaggs's family alleges the team and two former employees contributed to his death.. The family of Tyler Skaggs, the Los Angeles Angels pitcher who died of a drug overdose in 2019, has filed two lawsuits against the team, the owner's business and two former employees alleging wrongful death due to negligence and negligent hiring and supervision.

title: Israel's Foreign Minister Opens Embassy in U.A.E. After Detente
summary: Yair Lapid seeks to elevate relationship that has delivered few dividends since sides agreed to normalize ties last year. Israel's top diplomat inaugurated Tuesday the country's embassy in the United Arab Emirates and expressed hope for a new era of closer ties, as the two nations struggle to bridge differences over the recent Israeli-Palestinian conflict and deliver on the promise of a historic diplomatic accord.

title: Driver-Assistance Crashes Attract Closer U.S. Scrutiny
summary: Highway-safety regulator orders stricter reporting on wrecks involving automated-driving systems. Federal regulators are tightening their oversight of car crashes that involve advanced driver-assistance or automated-driving features, a shift that follows growing concern over the role that systems such as Tesla Inc.'s Autopilot have had in crashes.

title: U.K. Gives Visiting Executives More Leeway
summary: Executives must show that leaving self-isolation could serve to preserve or create more than 500 local jobs. LONDON-The U.K. will allow foreign senior executives to leave a 10-day quarantine required of overseas travelers, so long as they can show their business visit is of "significant economic benefit."

title: United Bets on Travel Revival With Biggest-Ever Plane Order
summary: The airline plans to buy 270 Boeing and Airbus planes as well as retrofitting some of its existing narrowbody fleet. United Airlines Holdings Inc. is making its largest ever plane order, adding Boeing and Airbus jets to fuel its post-pandemic growth plans.

title: U.S. Commander in Afghanistan Warns of Civil-War Risk as Security Deteriorates
summary: Gen. Scott Miller says rising violence makes a political solution more difficult. KABUL-The top U.S. military commander in Afghanistan said security across the country is deteriorating just weeks before the last American forces withdraw.

title: Your July Fourth Party Might Include Halloween, Christmas and Several Birthdays
summary: Families are combining multiple celebrations that had been postponed or canceled into one giant bash. When Jennifer Boyle started planning a post-pandemic family reunion, the TV show "Superstore" inspired her to supersize her plans.

title: How a SoftBank-Backed Construction Startup Burned Through $3 Billion
summary: Katerra's downfall shows how Silicon Valley's strategy of growth at any cost can backfire in complicated industries like real estate. Venture-backed startup Katerra Inc. aimed to revolutionize the construction business by mastering every element of the trade at once. Instead, its June bankruptcy filing made clear just how difficult it is for Silicon Valley to disrupt this complex industry.

title: The School That Wasn't There
summary: I drove 950 miles to give a commencement address. It was an elaborate hoax by a gun-control organization.. I was honored to deliver a commencement address to a Nevada high school this month. But the school didn't exist. It was a hoax perpetrated by gun-control activists.

title: Biden Tries to Save the Infrastructure Bill
summary: The president made an unforced error hitching the deal to action on other items.. One reason Americans hold Washington in such low repute: They have watched partisans hold bills with broad support hostage. Everyone knows that a proposal to create a legal status for Dreamers brought to America as minors would pass overwhelmingly in an up-or-down vote in the House and Senate. But for a decade neither party has let such a bill reach the floor.

title: Teneo CEO Declan Kelly Has Resigned
summary: Adviser to top CEOs says he stepped down to protect employees and clients; hands over title to co-founder Paul Keary. Declan Kelly has resigned as chairman and chief executive of global consulting firm Teneo Holdings LLC after reports of drunken misbehavior at a charity event last month.

title: Leonard Lauder's Mother, Estée, Showed Him How to Sell Beauty
summary: The former cosmetics CEO, who grew up in the Depression, was his mother's constant business companion. Leonard Lauder, 88, is chairman emeritus and the former CEO of the Estée Lauder Cos. Inc., where he is a member of the board. He is the author of "The Company I Keep: My Life in Beauty" (Harper Business), a memoir. He spoke with Marc Myers.

title: The Battle to Lure Back Premium Travelers Has Begun
summary: One reason for United Airlines' big move to renew its fleet may be the need to give its most lucrative clients a reason to leave home. Even as tourists fill U.S. planes again, business travelers have been slow to return to their old habits. Airlines may be willing to spend heavily to speed things up.

title: Japan's In-Home Robot Experiment Short Circuits
summary: SoftBank stops making Pepper robot, once seen as a family device for the masses, in latest pullback. TOKYO-Japan's humanoid robots are struggling to find homes.

title: Ghosn Escape Planners Michael and Peter Taylor Apologize to Japan
summary: Defendants tell Tokyo court they regret helping former Nissan chief sneak out on private jet. TOKYO-The man who helped Carlos Ghosn flee Japan bowed in apology and told a Tokyo courtroom that Mr. Ghosn decided at the last minute to turn a rehearsal into an actual escape.

title: Playboy Owner to Buy Lingerie Retailer for Over $330 Million
summary: Former magazine publisher's purchase is part of an effort to diversify beyond licensing its bunny-ear logo.

title: Warehouse Operators Turn to Wearable Technology to Solve Workplace Strains
summary: U.S. supply-chain arm of grocery store owner Ahold Delhaize is bringing 'exosuits' to its increasingly busy distribution centers. Your next load of groceries may be moved by a modern-day bionic man or woman.

title: This Spring Chicken Hatched a Vegan Nugget Startup
summary: Resume Subscription. Ben Pasternak just raised $50 million for his food-tech company. His products are carried by Target and Sam's Club. This is his third startup. He is 21 years old. Raised in Sydney, Australia, he has been living on his own in Manhattan since he turned 16.

title: U.S. Set to Fall Behind Europe on Vaccine First Doses
summary: Italy, Denmark and Belgium have already given a higher proportion of first doses than the U.S.. MILAN-Europe is catching up with the U.S. in Covid-19 vaccinations and could sprint ahead as the continent overcomes a stumbling start while parts of America struggle with vaccine hesitancy.

title: Former South African President Zuma Sentenced to 15 Months in Prison
summary: Sentence follows anti-apartheid fighter's refusal to appear at commission investigating alleged corruption during his time in office. JOHANNESBURG-South Africa's Constitutional Court sentenced former President Jacob Zuma to 15 months imprisonment for contempt of court Tuesday, after he refused to appear at a government-appointed commission investigating alleged corruption during his nine years in office.

title: Morgan Stanley, Carnival, Marin Software, SoFi: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today
summary: Big bank stocks were getting a boost from moves to raise dividends. Futures are wobbling after technology shares lifted the Nasdaq and the S&P 500 to record closes. Here's what we're watching ahead of the opening bell on Tuesday.

title: The New Key to Stanley Cup Glory: Fire the Coach
summary: The Montreal Canadiens are the third team in as many seasons to make the finals after firing their coach. Now the Habs interim coach has taken over from another interim coach.. If recent history is any indication, there's a new hack available to National Hockey League teams hoping to make the Stanley Cup Final: Fire your coach.

title: Toshiba Scandal Emboldens Foreign Investors Pushing Change in Japan
summary: Activist investors play roles at half of the Nikkei 225, and funds pour in to push for greater returns. TOKYO-When Toshiba Corp.'s shareholders ousted the company's chairman last week, it was a symbolic instance of foreign activist investors wielding influence in the Tokyo market. But it wasn't the only one.

title: Noma Wants to Bring Its Funky, Ancient Condiments Into Your Kitchen
summary: Copenhagen Chef René Redzepi is launching his restaurant's first line of products, starting with a line of garums, fermented sauces once popular in Roman times. Many top restaurants offer amateur cooks a chance to play top chef at home, with professional ingredients repackaged in small take-home batches, or sometimes spun off into big commercial productions. David Chang's Momofuku group often sells out its tingly seasoning salts and fiery chili crisp. Italian chef Massimo Bottura's bespoke olive oils and aged vinegars are more widely available at gourmet shops worldwide. Leave it to fermentation fanatic René Redzepi, of Noma in Copenhagen, to enter the retail market, a long-gestating idea, with a funky fungus. "It's something we've been thinking about for many years," he says. "But we were always too busy."

title: Former Chinese Party Insider Calls U.S. Hopes of Engagement 'Naive'
summary: On the eve of the Communist Party's anniversary, regime critic Cai Xia urges Washington to take 'hardheaded defensive measures'. A former Chinese Communist Party academic, now a critic of the regime, is urging the U.S. to abandon "naive" hopes to engage with Beijing, while warning that the country's leadership is more fragile than it appears.

title: Democrats in Oil Country Worried by Party's Natural-Gas Agenda
summary: Progressive agenda has moderates weathering Republican attack ads over oil and gas jobs. WASHINGTON-Democratic Party progressives are pushing President Biden to include in his infrastructure agenda stringent measures to address climate change, including policies designed to end the nation's reliance on natural gas as a fuel source.

title: Amazon Demands a Piece of Some Vendors
summary: Resume Subscription. Suppliers that want to land Amazon.com Inc. as a client for their goods and services can find that its business comes with a catch: the right for Amazon to buy big stakes in their companies at potentially steep discounts to market value.

title: Archegos Is a Warning for Aggressive Financial Markets, Says BIS
summary: Global club of central banks says investors might overreact to inflation even if it is temporary. The recent failure of U.S.-based Archegos Capital Management, a family office that made large, risky bets on a handful of stocks, could be a sign of how more investors might get tripped up by overreacting to inflationary risks, the global club of central banks warned on Tuesday.

title: BentallGreenOak Puts Grocery-Anchored Retail Centers on the Block
summary: Portfolio of shopping centers with Publix, Kroger and BJ's Wholesale stores could fetch up to $450 million. As essential businesses, grocery stores stayed open during the pandemic and some even chalked up a record sales volume, in contrast to many malls and other retail locations that remained closed for months.

title: China Attempts to Tame 'Wolf Warrior' Diplomats
summary: Nearing its 100th birthday, the Communist Party struggles to manage a contrast between its popularity at home and its stained reputation abroad. China's leadership is straining to dial back its country's chest-thumping "Wolf Warrior" approach to foreign policy, afraid it has begun to undermine the country's interests, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Banks' Next Act Gets Tougher
summary: Capital return is arriving after solid stress-test performances, so share gains might need a different kind of driver from here. Investors should savor the dividends and buybacks coming from big U.S. banks right now. They might not get the same kind of boost next year.

title: Despite Pressure, Biogen's Alzheimer's Drug Still a Likely Blockbuster
summary: Worries over Aduhelm's price and reimbursement have sparked a selloff in Biogen-and given investors a fresh opportunity. American taxpayers are set to foot most of the bill for Biogen 's new treatment for Alzheimer's disease, and investors are nervous.

title: Harvard, MIT Part of $800 Million Deal to Push Access to Online Education
summary: Education-technology company 2U to buy online-course platform edX; proceeds to go to a nonprofit run by the two universities. Education-technology company 2U Inc., which runs graduate programs for dozens of top universities, is buying web-based course provider edX, a nonprofit founded by Harvard University and the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, for $800 million.

title: Supersize Apartments Are Back in Demand
summary: Developers across U.S. try to meet millennials' needs and accommodate the shift to remote work. Apartment sizes are getting bigger across the U.S., just as more people are looking for additional space while spending more time working from home.

title: Dan Snyder Tries to End an Era of NFL Scandal With Progressive Pivot
summary: A diverse front office. A gender-neutral dance team. His wife as the new co-CEO. Snyder, the owner of the Washington Football Team, speaks out on his bid to fix a franchise plagued by internal problems.. Dan Snyder was terribly nervous.

title: Government Antitrust Lawsuits Against Facebook Dismissed by Federal Judge
summary: Judge rules that Federal Trade Commission and states didn't make valid claims that Facebook engaged in unlawful monopolization. WASHINGTON-A federal judge dismissed antitrust lawsuits against Facebook Inc. filed by the U.S. government and most states, a major win for the company before the cases even got off the ground.

title: Black-Owned Media Collective Launches to Help Brands Meet New Ad Commitments
summary: Group Black Inc. also intends to invest some proceeds in Black-owned media properties. Group Black Inc., a collective aimed at deepening the pipeline of Black-owned media companies, launched Tuesday with an ad-spending target of $75 million from a WPP PLC unit.

title: Property Investors Shelter in Quirky but Pricey Neighborhoods
summary: Interest in nontraditional real estate has skyrocketed during the pandemic. Property investors are finding new places to ride out the pandemic and its aftermath, but the risk of overpaying for so-called alternative real estate is growing.

title: More Vehicles Are Selling Above Sticker Price
summary: It's a seller's market, but production shortfalls also mean dealerships must manage with lower sales volume. The sticker price on cars isn't sticking. In some cases, it's going up.

title: Covid-19 Contact Tracers Race Against Delta Variant in U.S.
summary: Overwhelmed at pandemic's peak, public-health investigators now aim to reach each new case; 'We want to contain it completely'. Andrea Valencia worked the phone furiously day after long, dark day this past January, racing to reach people around Richmond, Va., who had tested positive for Covid-19.

title: Singapore Shows the Way Out of Pandemic Policies
summary: Countries that made zero-Covid strategies work in 2020 will have to change tack now that large-scale vaccination is a reality. As the West begins to peel back restrictions on movement and travel, many Asian governments that successfully prevented massive outbreaks of Covid-19 last year seem content to keep restrictions for the long haul. But in Singapore, that may be about to change.

title: 'Please Don't Give Up': Families Cling to Hope as Condo Death Toll Rises to 11
summary: Rescue crews search for 150 people unaccounted for in the collapse. SURFSIDE, Fla.-Rescue crews kept tunneling into the rubble of a collapsed condo tower, trying to find survivors at a site where no one has been found alive since Thursday.

title: Sanofi Bets on mRNA Vaccines After Covid-19 Pandemic Shows Worth
summary: One of the world's biggest vaccine makers, it plans to invest some $477 million a year to catch up in the new gene-based technology. Sanofi SA said it plans to build a messenger RNA vaccine business, the latest big drugmaker to embrace the technology.

title: House Passes Bipartisan Bill to Boost Scientific Competitiveness, Following Senate
summary: The two chambers will now have to negotiate a final version of the legislation before President Biden can sign it into law. WASHINGTON-The House on Monday approved its version of a legislative package aimed at boosting U.S. scientific competitiveness to keep pace with China, setting the stage for final negotiations with the Senate, which passed its own $250 billion bill earlier this month.

title: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: Logistics Company ShipBob Raises $200 Million
summary: Latest funding round pushes fulfillment specialist to valuation of more than $1 billion. ShipBob Inc., a company that helps small and midsize e-commerce companies fulfill orders, has reached a valuation of more than $1 billion with its latest round of funding.

title: Miami-Area Condo Board President Warned of Need for Repairs in April
summary: 'The concrete deterioration is accelerating. The roof situation got much worse,' condo board leader told residents. SURFSIDE, Fla.-The president of the Champlain South Towers condo association told residents in April their building was in desperate disrepair and urged them to pay the $15 million in assessments needed to fix structural problems, in a letter reviewed by The Wall Street Journal.

title: Iran-Backed Militias Attack U.S. Troops in Syria
summary: Militant assaults and American responses are elevating concerns about a deepening U.S. involvement. U.S. troops in northeast Syria came under rocket fire Monday night after Iran-backed militias vowed revenge for U.S. airstrikes earlier that day in Iraq and Syria, a sign that fighting may be evolving into sustained confrontation.

title: Amazon Maintains Lead in Cloud Infrastructure Market
summary: Even so, Amazon's share shrank a bit as the overall market expanded and other players gained. Amazon. com Inc. maintained a large lead in the market for cloud infrastructure, which rents computing, storage and networking capability to users, research firm Gartner Inc. said on Monday.

title: Facebook Rulings Leave Big Tech in Crosshairs
summary: The social-media giant's victory in FTC, states rulings show governments' big tech crackdowns aren't a slam dunk but remain a threat. Score one for big tech. But the game is still very much afoot.
